Question: Do we have to register English or can we not the English courses?
Answer: All students must register all English courses every semester until they have passed English 4.

Question: What do I do if I miss Ethic Seminar?
Answer: You can fill up the petition form to take another section. However, if you miss the last avalible section for the semester, unfortunatelty, you have to take it again next semester.

Question: For each semester, how many Business Ethic Seminar courses can I take?
Answer: You can only take one course per semester but, you can register past Business Ethic Seminar courses that you haven?t passed. For example, in the past semester you haven?t passed BG14031. In this semester, you are able to register for BG14032 and BG14031 (the course you haven?t passed).

Question: During the pre-registering period, how many times can I modify my schedule?
Answer: You are able to modify your schedule up to 3 times.

Question: How come there is a room with 60 seats but the seat availability is only 50?
Answer: The number of seat available is appropriated by the faculty not Registrar office and is not up to the number of seats there is in a room.

Question: Why does my friend have the status of ?expecting to graduate? but I don?t even though we?re in the same batch/year?
Answer: Students expecting to graduate have had reached their expected amount of credits in the first semester and second semester of 120 credits and above. For summer terms, they must have 133 credits and above.

Question: Are we able to register courses that have an Exam Time Conflict?
Answer: Students that are graduating the semester they are registering their courses can have exam time conflict courses. However, that is only for students who are graduating the semester they are registering for.

Question: Am I able to register a pre-requisite course with a course that requires the pre-requisite?
Answer: Students that haven?t passed the pre-requisite course the semester before must pass the pre-requisite course first. For example, MGT 3907 has a pre-requisite course of English 4. Thus, you must have passed English 4 first before registering MGT 3907. - In the case where the student has to pre-register a class requiring a pre-requisite. For example, English 4 and the grade releases after you have paid for MGT 3907 you can come and delete the course afterwards during the adding period (the first two weeks once the semester opens) you will be refunded for the total amount of the course.

Question: Where can I check the pre-requisite for a course?
Answer: Ask your faculty?s information center - From the webpage of your faculty - In the AU Spark, once you have selected your course and section there will be details concerning the pre-requisite.

Question: How many credits can I register per semester?
Answer: How many credits can I register per semester? 9.1 First semester and second semester

Question: I have to register more than the allotted Credit Limits, what do I have to do?
Answer: In the case that the credits do not exceed 22 credits, write a petition detailing the reason for registering more than the allotted credit limit and ask for the signature of the chair person or the dean. Once signed, bring the petition to the Office of Registrar during the registration period - In the case that the credits exceed 22 credits, write the petition as stated above then you must get the signature of the dean afterwards bring the petition to the vice president for academic affairs to sign, then bring the petition to the office of registrar during the registration period.

Question: Where do I check the name list of those who are graduating?
Answer: You can check from the webpage www.au.edu then login from the front page of the university, www.registrar.au.edu and facebook fan page ABAC Registrar Office.

Question: In which case do we receive a full refund for deleting a course or changing a section during the adding period?
Answer: The course or subject is closed - When the grade is released and have not passed the pre-requisite course

Question: I wasn?t able to register a subject in time but I?m graduating this semester (have checked the semester before) and it?s a mandatory subject, what do I have to do?
Answer: The University Registrar has no jurisdiction to increase the seat limit the faculty has appropriated. If the student needs to register the course with that section and that section has all available seats filled, contact the faculty to increase the seat limit.

Question: Can I register my classes from the webpage and my mobile phone app?
Answer: It is not recommended to do so as registering from both platforms will increase the amount of strain on the registration system. There is also a chance that registering from both platforms will use up all allotted modifications to the schedule.

Question: During what times can we modify the schedule?
Answer: During the designated pre-registration block - Between 16.00 ? 17.00 of each pre-registration day

Question: When registering course with one instructor, once the semester begins it is another instructor that teaches the course?
Answer: Because the faculty changes the instructor due to a variety of reasons. For example, the said instructor has resigned from his teaching role in the university without prior notice.

Question: Can I take courses from a different faculty or department?
Answer: You can have 2 free elective courses (6 credits) which you can take from any other falculty. However, make sure you check the prerequisites ad falculty website for the avalibility of the course. Examples of some  Free Electives GE1405 (Thai Language and Culture), GE2101 (World Civilization),  BG1301 (Business Law 1)

Question: What should I do if a course I need is full during registration?
Answer: You can fill up the petition form to add the course during adding period. However, you need to get aprroval signature from the course lecturer and dean the falculty.

Question: Can I switch to a different section of the same course after the semester begins?
Answer: You can always fill up the petition form to change section. However, make sure that the section you want to change has seats avalible.

Question: How do I know if a course I'm interested in is still available for registration?
Answer: You can check AU Spark during the pre-registeration period for seat avalibilty.

Question: What happens if I miss the registration deadline?
Answer: You can contact the registeration office.

Question: What are the requirements for graduating with honors?
Answer: Undergraduate students can graduate with honors based on their GPA: Summa Cum Laude (3.80-4.00), Magna Cum Laude (3.50-3.79), and Cum Laude (3.25-3.49). Requirements include completing all graduation requirements within 4 years (5 years for Architecture), no probation, no grades below 'C', and transfer students must complete the last 72 credits at Assumption University. Students with a GPA of 3.25 or higher who meet these criteria may receive an Award of Academic Excellence.

Question: How can I check my credit status towards graduation?
Answer: You can always check AU Spark for the credit taken. For graduation requirement, every major is different and you can check your falculty website or confirm with your advisor for the required creditc to graduate.

Question: Can I transfer credits from another university?
Answer: Yes. However, you must confirm with the registeration office and submit require document before getting aprroval for credit transfer courses.

Question: Is there a limit to how many summer courses I can take to catch up on credits?
Answer: Students can take a maximun of 7 credits during the summer.

Question: Where can I find academic advising services?
Answer: You can check your advisor on AU spark. If you don't see the name contact your faculty office.

Question: What are the payment options for tuition and fees?
Answer: You can check the payment schedule from school website and pay online. If you encounter any complictions, you can contact the registeration offic eand pay in person.

Question: How do I request an official transcript or other academic records?
Answer: You can contact the registeration office. (SM116)

Answer: You can find the academic calendar on our website

Question: How do I get my Transcript?
Answer: You can find the Intruction for Online Transcript at our website

Answer: You can find more information about AU spark on our website

Question: What is VME?
Answer: Vincent Mary School of Engineering (VME) at Assumption University (ABAC) is an academic institution that offers engineering programs, emphasizing a practical and hands-on approach to education in various engineering disciplines.

Question: What is ABAC?
Answer: Assumption University of Thailand (ABAC) is a private Catholic university in Bangkok, known for its international focus and diverse academic programs.

Question: What is the purpose of the chatbot?
Answer: The chatbot is designed to assist students by providing quick answers to common queries related to academic programs, course information, and university policies.

Question: How does the chatbot generate responses?
Answer: The chatbot uses advanced natural language processing (NLP) techniques to understand user questions and provide relevant responses based on a database of combined datasets.

Question: Can I ask the chatbot about specific courses?
Answer: Yes! You can ask about any courses offered at the university, including prerequisites, schedules, and professor information.

Question: Is the chatbot able to answer questions about professors?
Answer: Absolutely! The chatbot can provide information about professors, including their contact details, courses they teach, and office hours.

Question: How can I provide feedback on the chatbot's responses?
Answer: After each response, you will see options to give feedback (thumbs up or thumbs down). You can also provide detailed feedback to help improve the chatbot’s accuracy.

Question: What kind of information can I get from the chatbot?
Answer: You can inquire about course names, professor names, free elective courses, and general university information, among other academic-related queries.

Question: Can the chatbot help me with scheduling or registration?
Answer: While the chatbot can provide general information, please refer to the official university registration portal for specific scheduling and registration processes.

Question: What should I do if the chatbot cannot answer my question?
Answer: If the chatbot is unable to provide an answer, it may suggest contacting academic advisors or relevant departments for further assistance.

Question: How is my data handled by the chatbot?
Answer: User interactions and feedback are logged for improving the chatbot's performance. Personal information is not stored, and user privacy is a priority.

Question: Will the chatbot evolve over time?
Answer: Yes! The chatbot is designed to learn from user interactions and feedback, continually improving its ability to assist students effectively.

Question: Is the chatbot available 24/7?
Answer: Yes! The chatbot is available at any time to assist you with your inquiries.

Question: What are the requirements to change my major?
Answer: To change your major, you must submit a request form to the Registrar's Office along with any required documentation, including a statement of purpose.

Question: How can I find out about internship opportunities?
Answer: You can check the Career Services Center on campus, attend career fairs, or look at postings on the university's job portal for internship opportunities.

Question: Can I take a course at another university and transfer the credits to ABAC?
Answer: Yes, but you must seek prior approval from your faculty advisor and submit a transfer credit request to ensure the course meets ABAC's standards.

Question: What should I do if I am struggling in my classes?
Answer: You should contact your professors for assistance, visit the academic support center, or seek tutoring services offered by the university.

Question: Are there any scholarships available for international students?
Answer: Yes, ABAC offers several scholarships for international students. Check the university's financial aid website for more information on eligibility and application procedures.

Question: How do I access my student email?
Answer: You can access your student email through the university's portal using your student ID and password.

Question: What are the library hours?
Answer: The library hours vary by day; please check the library's website or contact them directly for current hours.

Question: How can I report a campus emergency?
Answer: In case of an emergency, call campus security at the designated emergency number or use the emergency buttons located throughout the campus.

Question: What is the process for appealing a grade?
Answer: To appeal a grade, you must submit a written request to the instructor within a specified timeframe, outlining your reasons for the appeal.

Question: Are there any clubs or organizations I can join?
Answer: Yes, ABAC has a variety of clubs and organizations catering to different interests. You can find a list of them on the student affairs website or at the student center.
